intro: Hieracium gracilentum var. varangerense, commonly known as the Varanger hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of Europe and North America. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish-green composite flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, nutrient-poor soils, often in tundra or alpine environments. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in cold climates. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its harsh native habitat.
